result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: With credit for 101 days time served

Defendant to report to probation intake and provide DNA sample by 06-24-2022
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 @ 01:30pm

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Pay all supervision fees, court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

- NO CONTACT with victim F.F unless approved by the Court.
- THIRD PARTY CONTACT for the purpose of child visitation, third party to be approved by the Agent.
- NO CONTACT with firearms.

- Batterers Intervention Program.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

- AODA assessment; comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1; with credit for 101 days time served

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia

records.addlTxt: Court is in receipt of Probation Review Hearing memo.  Based upon report, Court will vacate scheduled hearing.  If further review hearings are needed, DOC agent to contact the Court.
Received and Filed. probation review memo

Defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia in court with attorney Gregory W Isaac.  Defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Arraignment held.  Original amended information has been e-filed; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading and pleads not guilty subject to the Court accepting change of plea today. Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to AMENDED COUNTS 1, 2, & 3. On the state's motion, Court STRIKES Domestic Abuse Repeater enhancer as to COUNTS 1, 2, & 3.

Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Custody Credit Form, filed.
Jury Instructions, filed.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND (expires 8/16/2022).

Attorney Gregory W Isaac in court, defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered $2,000.00 CASH with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5,000.00 CASH.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Attorney Gregory W Isaac in court, defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court ordered $2,000.00 CASH with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5,000.00 CASH.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bond, filed.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35: 
Defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia in court with Attorney Gregory W Isaac; both appear by video.  Defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Milwaukee Officer L. Roth & Corp. S. Pawlak. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss and Demand for Speedy Trial.  (Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia, House of Correction - P-6/Bed 6, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court modifies bail to $5,000.00 CASH. All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Attorney Matt W Kline in court appearing as a friend of the Court, defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court modifies bail to $5,000.00 CASH. All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. Case remains calendared in Branch PE.
Court strikes (939.621(1)(b) enhancer

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; 24 hour curfew.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with F.R.F (dob 8/21/1990) or her children
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Clement Urban-Tapia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Court strikes Domestic Abuse Repeater Enhancer (939.621(1)(b)).  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense request bail bond hearing in trial court.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.   This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3

Case is adjourned to Br. PE For Branch 35. Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea

Prior: 5227 West Beloit Road, West Milwaukee, WI 53214
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
